explanations.summary: Conduction velocities: SA node SLOWEST (~0.05 m/s) due to Ca²⁺-dependent APs, small cells, poor gap junctions. AV node also slow. Bundle of His and Purkinje fastest (~4 m/s). Ventricular muscle intermediate (~1 m/s).

whyCorrect.a: SA node has the SLOWEST conduction velocity (~0.05 m/s). Reasons: (1) Ca²⁺-dependent action potentials (slow upstroke); (2) Small cell size; (3) Sparse gap junctions; (4) This slow conduction allows proper pacemaker function.

whyIncorrect.b: Bundle of His has FAST conduction (~1-2 m/s) to rapidly transmit impulses to ventricles.
whyIncorrect.c: Ventricles have intermediate velocity (~1 m/s) - faster than nodes but slower than Purkinje fibers.
whyIncorrect.d: Atria have moderate conduction velocity (~1 m/s), not the slowest.
whyIncorrect.e: Conduction velocity is NOT the same everywhere - it varies dramatically from 0.05 m/s (SA node) to 4 m/s (Purkinje fibers).
